text: The 1936-37 Austrian football championship was organized by the Vienna Football Association and contested by its members. During the season the organisation was transferred to the National League Committee. The two-tiered Second League served as the foundation for the First League. These leagues were open only to professional football clubs. Other Austrian state associations organized regional championships in various amateur formats. The champions subsequently competed for a champion in the Amateur Championship. Post SV Wien became amateur champion. The numerous double events were increasingly criticized. Spectators only wanted to see their own team and often didn't even watch a second game. Austria Soccer ==Mode == The First League championship was contested by 12 teams. Each of the teams met twice throughout the season. SK Admira Wien became Austrian football champions for the sixth time. ==Final table== Table mode (in case of equal points): 1st criterion goal quotient Pl. Name M W D L P 1\.
